title: Independent ELICOS Sector visa (subclass 570)
summary: This page provides information for existing holders of the Independent ELICOS Sector visa (subclass 570), which closed to new applications on 1 July 2016. It explains visa validity, work rights, obligations, rules for changing education providers, and requirements for students under 18 and accompanying family members.

eligible_individuals: People who already hold a subclass 570 visa
People who applied on or before 30 June 2016 and have not yet received a decision
applicability.purpose: Explains rights and obligations of current or pending visa holders

visa_validity.valid_until: Original expiry date specified at time of visa grant

conditions: Up to 40 hours per fortnight while course is in session
Unlimited hours during scheduled course breaks
Must comply with State and Territory workplace laws
Up to 40 hours per fortnight once the student has commenced their course

family_member_study_rights.study_over_3_months: Requires separate student visa (can be applied for in Australia)

student_obligations: Must apply for a new Student Visa (subclass 500) when changing to a course in a different education sector

streamlined_visa_processing_svp_conditio.requirement: Must continue to satisfy SVP requirements
streamlined_visa_processing_svp_conditio.risk_of_cancellation: If transferring to a provider not eligible for SVP (prior to 1 July 2016)
risk_conditions: Within first 12 months of visa grant
Student is not from a country that was Assessment Level 1 before 1 July 2016

obligations.check_conditions: Check visa conditions through VEVO or visa grant letter

requirements: Must comply with ESOS National Code requirements
changing_education_provider.principal_course_requirement: Must complete six months of principal course unless special circumstances apply
changing_education_provider.transfer_permission: Usually required from current education provider
changing_education_provider.provider_responsibilities: Education provider must assess transfer request and have documented transfer procedures

appeal_process.internal: Use education provider's internal appeal process
appeal_process.external: Can appeal to State/Territory Ombudsman or Overseas Student Ombudsman

requirements: Must maintain adequate accommodation, support, and general welfare arrangements
Cannot travel to Australia until welfare arrangements commence if approved by provider
students_under_18.welfare_start_date: Date nominated by education provider on CAAW letter
students_under_18.guardian_absence_requirement: Must arrange alternate welfare arrangements approved by the department before guardian leaves Australia
students_under_18.risk_of_cancellation: If welfare arrangements are not approved before guardian departure

no_further_stay_condition.effect: Cannot apply to stay in Australia beyond visa date except in certain circumstances

general_requirements: Remain a family member during their stay
Work no more than 40 hours per fortnight and only after student commences course
family_member_obligations.consequence_of_noncompliance: May result in cancellation of the primary visa holder's visa
